definition: lit. on brocade, add flowers (idiom); to decorate sth already perfect/gilding the lily
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful

sentences.english: And old instruments often have a history that adds to their lustre.
sentences.chinese: 而古旧乐器又有着一段历史让其熠熠生辉，锦上添花。

sentences.english: A smarter approach to mark-down management is just the icing on the cake.
sentences.chinese: 更巧妙的减价管理办法不过是锦上添花。

sentences.english: The red lionfish sports maroon and white stripes to complement its venomous spines.
sentences.chinese: 红狮子鱼褐白相间的条纹真是为它的毒刺锦上添花。

sentences.english: If the exquisite production craft, it will be icing on the cake.
sentences.chinese: 如果在制作时工艺精湛，那就更会锦上添花。

sentences.english: His article praising classical Greek art is just gilding lily.
sentences.chinese: 他的那篇高度评价古典希腊艺术的论文真是锦上添花。

sentences.english: A free vacation on top of a pay raise is icing on the cake.
sentences.chinese: 加了工资还有工资照发的假期，真是锦上添花。

sentences.english: These miniature glasses will bring a sparkle to your party.
sentences.chinese: 这些小玻璃杯将为您的聚会锦上添花。

sentences.english: A moral panic about devil-worship only drove sales higher.
sentences.chinese: 恶魔崇拜的思想狂潮只不过让其销量锦上添花而已。

sentences.english: The orange dahlias at Serena's table are the perfect hue for a Thanksgiving dinner.
sentences.chinese: 桌上的橙色大丽花为美好的感恩时节锦上添花。

definition: lit. to send charcoal in snowy weather (idiom)/fig. to provide help in sb's hour of need
lit. draw legs on a snake (idiom); fig. to ruin the effect by adding sth superfluous/to overdo it
to enhance by contrast/to set off/to serve as a background in order to bring out the subject with greater brilliance/to serve as a prop/a foil
only natural/as it should be/certainly/of course/without doubt
lit. the voice of the guest overwhelms that of the host (idiom)/fig. a minor player upstages the main attraction/minor details obscure the main point/the sauce is better than the fish
to take it up a notch/to bring it up a level
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
lit. like a tiger that has grown wings/with redoubled power (idiom)
